idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows Vista Version 6.1 (Build 7600) ; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.1.4000

descript.abstract: United States Transportation Terminals is a point theme representing transportation terminals such as bus stations, train stations, marine terminals, and other significant transportation nodes in the United States. Attribute information includes the name, type and FCC code of the terminals.
descript.purpose: United States Transportation Terminals provides the locations of transportation terminals. All transportation terminals are named and show the state and county they reside in.
descript.supplinf: Largest scale when displaying the data: 1:50,000.

cntinfo.cntinst:
In the United States– Please direct all inquiries regarding software/data pricing and consulting services to your local Esri Regional Office. For support, you may contact Esri Support Center by telephone (voice) between 5:00 a.m. and 5:00 p.m. Pacific time, Monday through Friday, by dialing 888-377-4575; facsimile (fax) available at 909-792-0960; electronic mail (e-mail) support@esri.com; or visit http://support.esri.com/; Esri holidays excluded.
Outside the United States– Please direct all inquiries regarding software/data pricing, sales, support, and consulting services to your local Esri Office. This information can be found at http://www.esri.com/about-esri/locations.html.
For other questions or comments, you may contact Esri headquarters by e-mail, telephone, or fax or write to us.

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standards for Digital Geospatial Metadata

cntorgp.cntorg: Research Data Services (RDS), Columbia University Libraries

enttyp.enttypd: The points represent the locations within the United States for transportation terminals such as public transport stops, railway stations, metro stations, ferry terminals, and other significant transportation nodes.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: The FIPS code (two-digit number) for the state in which the transportation terminal is located combined with the FIPS code (three-digit number) for the county in which the transportation terminal is located.
attr.attrdefs: Department of Commerce, National Institute of Standards and Technology

codesetd.codesetn: INCITS 38:200x, (Formerly FIPS 5-2) Codes; INCITS 31:200x, (Formerly FIPS 6-4) Codes

attr.attrdef: The official name of the transportation terminal.
The Feature Classification Code of the transportation terminal.
The feature type description of the transportation terminal.
The MultiNet feature code of the transportation terminal.
The length of the text in the NAME attribute.

digtinfo.formspec: The SDC file contains the geospatial and attribute data. The SDI file contains the spatial index. The PRJ file contains the coordinate system information (optional). The XML file (*.sdc.xml) contains the metadata describing the data set (optional).

stdorder.ordering: Data & Maps is available only as part of Esri® software.

cntinfo.cntinst:
In the United States, contact the Esri Telebusiness staff at 800-447-9778 for more information about our software and data.
Outside the United States, please direct all inquiries to your local Esri Office. This information can be found at http://www.esri.com/about-esri/locations.html.

distinfo.techpreq: To use this data requires software that supports SDC files.

citeinfo.title: TomTom MultiNet POI North America; TomTom MultiNet Administrative Areas, 2012

serinfo.sername: TomTom® MultiNet® POI North America; TomTom® MultiNet® North America

srcinfo.srccitea: TomTom MultiNet North America v. 2011.09 and v. 2010.03

procstep.srcused: TomTom MultiNet North America v. 2011.09 and v. 2010.03
procstep.procdesc: The following steps were performed by Esri: Extracted the Points of Interest (POI) data set from TomTom MultiNet POI North America v. 2011.09. Selected features that intersected Data & Maps 10 U.S. Counties to get the U.S. features only. Selected the public transport stop, railway station, and ferry terminal features. Renamed MultiNet field FEATTYP to MNFC. Added field FCC and calculated its values based on MultiNet FEATTYP equivalents. Added field FEATTYPE and copied its values from MultiNet FEATTYP descriptions. Added field TEXTLENGTH and calculated its values to the length of the text in the NAME field. Added the STCTYFIPS field and coded it by overlaying on Data & Maps 10 U.S. Counties. Converted the data set to SDC. Created ArcGIS® layer file (.lyr), projection file (.prj), and spatial indices.

horizpa.horizpar: Horizontal positional accuracy is dependent on geographic area. In most areas, accuracy is between 5 and 25 meters (16 and 82 feet). In some areas, accuracy is off by up to several tens of meters (100 feet or more). In the poorest areas, accuracy is off by up to 100 meters (328 feet).

dataqual.logic: The shapefile is converted to SDC (Smart Data Compression) format using tools in ArcGIS. The SDC data set is then imported into a file geodatabase to verify, validate, and if needed repair the geometry.
dataqual.complete: After processing, the data set is checked for drawing display and number of records and file sizes compared with source materials.
